alert.note: Alert for Eddy County Plains; Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:05PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EDDY...SOUTHWESTERN LEA AND NORTHWESTERN CULBERSON COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM MDT... At 704 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Carlsbad North, or over Carlsbad, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Artesia, Hope, Loving, Avalon, Seven Rivers Airport, Malaga, Brantley Lake State Park, Carlsbad North, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Whites City, Lincoln National Forest, Lea County Zip Franklin Memorial Airport, Loco Hills, Queen, Artesia Municipal Airport, Otis, Cavern City Air Terminal, Living Desert State Park, and Dayton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eddy County Plains; Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County
